Immortality-45.op_claim: I remain unconvinced that my death has a fixed 100% probability, CMV.
Immortality-45.op_premise: [Context, Despite the overwhelming evidence that all human life so far has been subject to mortality, I still remain skeptical its impossible to achieve immortality. There are already effectively immortal lifeforms existing on Earth (eg. certain jellyfish, plants, lobsters) why couldnt clever scientists eventually transpose the benefits to human life?]

reply_contents.content: First of all, whether or not this is true depends on how stringently you mean 100%
elo_info: First of all, whether this is true depends on how stringently you mean 100%

elo_info.message: Perhaps you can shorten this phrase to just 'whether'. It is correct though if you mean 'regardless of whether'.

reply_contents.content: If we get right down to it we can\t know that we\re not, say, living in some sort of computer simulation
elo_info: If we get right down to it we can\t know that we\re not, say, living in some sort of computer simulation

reply_contents.content: if that\s the case the real world could be anything you could imagine with any sort of arbitrary physics and rules
elo_info: if that\s the case the real world could be anything you could imagine with any sort of arbitrary physics and rules

reply_contents.content: Nothing (with perhaps the exception of math and logic) can be known for sure
elo_info: Nothing (with perhaps the exception of math and logic) can be known for sure

reply_contents.content: But, that makes for a boring argument
elo_info: But, that makes for a boring argument

reply_contents.content: So lets start with the premise that reality exists and is pretty much how we observe it
elo_info: So Let's start with the premise that reality exists and is pretty much how we observe it

elo_info.message: Did you mean 'Let's' (let's = let us; lets = 3rd person singular of 'let')?

reply_contents.content: Not too much to ask, right
elo_info: Not too much to ask, right

reply_contents.content: The first thing youll realize when you start thinking about this is that to have a non-zero chance of dying you have to live forever
elo_info: The first thing you'll realize when you start thinking about this is that to have a non-zero chance of dying you have to live forever

reply_contents.content: Were not talking about just living indefinitely long, replacing organs as you go and whatnot, but instead I should be able to name any time in the future and youll still be around
elo_info: Were not talking about just living indefinitely long, replacing organs as you go and whatnot, but instead I should be able to name any time in the future and you'll still be around

reply_contents.content: Lets take a look at what that will take
elo_info: Let's take a look at what that will take

elo_info.message: Did you mean 'Let's' (let's = let us; lets = 3rd person singular of 'let')?

reply_contents.content: 100 years: Ill assume youre in your early twenties right now so I have a number to work with
elo_info: 100 years: I'll assume you're in your early twenties right now so I have a number to work with

reply_contents.content: The longest living person that Im aware of was Jeanne Calment who lived to the age of 122
elo_info: The longest living person that I'm aware of was Jeanne Calmest who lived to the age of 122

reply_contents.content: So, if you want to live another 100 years, you could maybe do it just with good genes and good luck
elo_info: So, if you want to live another 100 years, you could maybe do it just with good genes and good luck

reply_contents.content: Were only looking for a non-zero chance, so were doing good so far
elo_info: Were only looking for a non-zero chance, so were doing good so far

reply_contents.content: 200 years: Congratulations
elo_info: 200 years: Congratulations

reply_contents.content: Youve lived another 200 years and managed to break all records of human lifespan previously known
elo_info: You've lived another 200 years and managed to break all records of human lifespan previously known

reply_contents.content: To get to this point unprecedented medical advances have been made
elo_info: To get to this point unprecedented medical advances have been made

reply_contents.content: New organs can be grown replaced as you need them, and methods have been devised to keep your brain cells healthy, or at least to replace them bit by bit
elo_info: New organs can be grown replaced as you need them, and methods have been devised to keep your brain cells healthy, or at least to replace them bit by bit

reply_contents.content: Or maybe you do get a brain replacement every now and then, but your old memories, personality, intelligence, etc.  are imprinted on it
elo_info: Or maybe you do get a brain replacement now and then, but your old memories, personality, intelligence, etc. are imprinted on it

elo_info.message: Possible typo: you repeated a whitespace

reply_contents.content: Would that still count as you
elo_info: Would that still count as you

reply_contents.content: For the sake of argument lets say sure, why not
elo_info: For the sake of argument lets say sure, why not

reply_contents.content: Almost as important as the advances in medical technology is your access to it
elo_info: Almost as important as the advances in medical technology is your access to it

reply_contents.content: Perhaps this tech is available only to the rich and influential, or maybe its so cheap and easy everyone can use it
elo_info: Perhaps this tech is available only to the rich and influential, or maybe its so cheap and easy everyone can use it

reply_contents.content: In any case, youve managed to discover the fountain of youth, and you have a long life ahead of you
elo_info: In any case, you've managed to discover the fountain of youth, and you have a long life ahead of you

reply_contents.content: 10,000 years: A lot has changed in your lifetime
elo_info: 10,000 years: A lot has changed in your lifetime

reply_contents.content: Youre one of the oldest humans alive, having been lucky enough to be in the first generation that had access to effective immortality
elo_info: You're one of the oldest humans alive, having been lucky enough to be in the first generation that had access to effective immortality

reply_contents.content: Aging and disease are distant memories
elo_info: Aging and disease are distant memories

reply_contents.content: Youve managed to live through the strife caused by the end of death
elo_info: You've managed to live through the strife caused by the end of death

reply_contents.content: Perhaps that elixir of immortality is available to only a select few, or perhaps humanity has spread beyond Earth to cope with an ever-growing population, or maybe childbirth is strictly controlled
elo_info: Perhaps that elixir of immortality is available to only a select few, or perhaps humanity has spread beyond Earth to cope with an ever-growing population, or maybe childbirth is strictly controlled

reply_contents.content: Whatever happened society lives on, and you with it
elo_info: Whatever happened society lives on, and you with it

reply_contents.content: 100,000 years: Youve managed to go a thousand centuries without your head getting crushed under the back wheels of a bus
elo_info: 100,000 years: You've managed to go a thousand centuries without your head getting crushed under the back wheels of a bus

reply_contents.content: Kudos
elo_info: Kudos

reply_contents.content: 1,000,000 years: A million years
elo_info: 1,000,000 years: A million years

reply_contents.content: Wow
elo_info: Wow

reply_contents.content: How much memory can the human mind hold, anyway
elo_info: How much memory can the human mind hold, anyway

reply_contents.content: Do you remember your childhood, your first kiss, the face of your parents
elo_info: Do you remember your childhood, your first kiss, the face of your parents

reply_contents.content: Perhaps you have some sort of external memory
elo_info: Perhaps you have some sort of external memory

reply_contents.content: How recognizable would you be now to yourself in the year 2013AD
elo_info: How recognizable would you be now to yourself in the year 2013AD

reply_contents.content: Are you still human, even
elo_info: Are you still human, even

reply_contents.content: Whatever you are, lets say that youre still you, and youve lived this long
elo_info: Whatever you are, lets say that you're still you, and you've lived this long

reply_contents.content: Youve seen the rise and fall of countless civilizations
elo_info: You've seen the rise and fall of countless civilizations

reply_contents.content: Most of human history is in your mind
elo_info: Most of human history is in your mind

reply_contents.content: The invention of agriculture and the city happened a mere 10,000 years before you were born
elo_info: The invention of agriculture and the city happened a mere 10,000 years before you were born

reply_contents.content: at this point, thats pretty much a rounding error in your age
elo_info: at this point, that's pretty much a rounding error in your age

reply_contents.content: 109 years: The Earth is about 5.54 billion years old now
elo_info: 109 years: The Earth is about 5.54 billion years old now

reply_contents.content: Youve been around for 18% of that
elo_info: You've been around for 18% of that

reply_contents.content: When you were born there had been five major mass extinction events in Earths history
elo_info: When you were born there had been five major mass extinction events in Earths history

elo_info.message: “When” at the beginning of a sentence requires a 2nd clause. Maybe a comma, question or exclamation mark is missing, or the sentence is incomplete and should be joined with the following sentence.

reply_contents.content: Has another one happened by now
elo_info: Has another one happened by now

reply_contents.content: Perhaps a giant comet or meteor has struck the Earth in your lifetime, shrouding it in a cloud of debris that blocked the sun
elo_info: Perhaps a giant comet or meteor has struck the Earth in your lifetime, shrouding it in a cloud of debris that blocked the sun

reply_contents.content: Maybe a nearby star went super nova and bathed the Earth in gamma radiation, driving you and everyone else underground
elo_info: Maybe a nearby star went super nova and bathed the Earth in gamma radiation, driving you and everyone else underground

reply_contents.content: Whatever has or hasnt happened, humanity must have god-like technology by now for you to have survived this long
elo_info: Whatever has or hasn't happened, humanity must have god-like technology by now for you to have survived this long

reply_contents.content: Were definitely in the realm of science fiction now, but you said 100% certainty, so why not
elo_info: Were definitely in the realm of science fiction now, but you said 100% certainty, so why not

reply_contents.content: 3 x 109 years: The Milky Way and the nearby Andromeda galaxy merge
elo_info: 3 x 109 years: The Milky Way and the nearby Andromeda galaxy merge

reply_contents.content: Youve seen Andromeda grow in the night sky from the little smudge it is today to a giant, sky filling wonder
elo_info: You've seen Andromeda grow in the night sky from the little smudge it is today to a giant, sky filling wonder

reply_contents.content: Dont worry, galaxies are mostly empty space, so its very unlikely that our sun will be hit by another star
elo_info: Don't worry, galaxies are mostly empty space, so its very unlikely that our sun will be hit by another star

reply_contents.content: You and whoever else is around will have to think of a name for the new galaxy that forms
elo_info: You and whoever else is around will have to think of a name for the new galaxy that forms

reply_contents.content: 5 x 109 years: Youre about half as old as the Earth now and the sun is dying
elo_info: 5 x 109 years: You're about half as old as the Earth now and the sun is dying

reply_contents.content: As it burns through its hydrogen fuel it begins to fuse helium and heavier elements
elo_info: As it burns through its hydrogen fuel it begins to fuse helium and heavier elements

reply_contents.content: The sun expands and swallows up the planet Mercury, then Venus
elo_info: The sun expands and swallows up the planet Mercury, then Venus

reply_contents.content: You had better hope that there was a well funded space program sometime in the last few billion years because Earth is not a fun place right now
elo_info: You had better hope that there was a well funded space program sometime in the last few billion years because Earth is not a fun place right now

reply_contents.content: The oceans have boiled away and the surface is a scorched desert, to say the least
elo_info: The oceans have boiled away and the surface is a scorched desert, to say the least

reply_contents.content: At noon the giant, red sun fills the entire sky from horizon to horizon
elo_info: At noon the giant, red sun fills the entire sky from horizon to horizon

reply_contents.content: Hopefully youve invested in a nice retirement home on Europa
elo_info: Hopefully you've invested in a nice retirement home on Europa

reply_contents.content: (continued)
elo_info: (continued)

reply_contents.content: I assume you refer to this species of jellyfish, although that\s the only known instance of immortality
elo_info: I assume you refer to this species of jellyfish, although that\s the only known instance of immortality

reply_contents.content: Although, the immortality part is only theoretical, eventually they die
elo_info: Although, the immortality part is only theoretical, eventually they die

reply_contents.content: Humans are far too complex and have far too many cells to do this
elo_info: Humans are far too complex and have far too many cells to do this

reply_contents.content: Jellyfish are a much larger percentage water than we are
elo_info: Jellyfish are a much larger percentage water than we are

reply_contents.content: In order to achieve immortality youd have to revert all the humans cells back to immaturity, and youd also have to put the lost amounts of telomeres back onto the ends of the chromosomes
elo_info: In order to achieve immortality you'd have to revert all the humans cells back to immaturity, and you'd also have to put the lost amounts of elodeas back onto the ends of the chromosomes

reply_contents.content: The problem is that even if you could successfully revert cells back to immaturity, its not like you can just go back to being a baby like the jellyfish can, youd be a grown man with the cells of a baby (by baby I mean fetus)
elo_info: The problem is that even if you could successfully revert cells back to immaturity, its not like you can just go back to being a baby like the jellyfish can, you'd be a grown man with the cells of a baby (by baby I mean fetus)

reply_contents.content: Youd die very quickly
elo_info: You'd die very quickly

reply_contents.content: Furthermore, resetting human cells, which are interconnected and work in systems, would be catastrophic
elo_info: Furthermore, resetting human cells, which are interconnected and work in systems, would be catastrophic

reply_contents.content: Similarly, youd be reversing the life cycle of the cells back to stem cells, which are totipotent
elo_info: Similarly, you'd be reversing the life cycle of the cells back to stem cells, which are totipotent

reply_contents.content: Youd have to reverse the entire life cycle to get this to work
elo_info: You'd have to reverse the entire life cycle to get this to work

reply_contents.content: In which case youd have to accommodate for the wear and tear on your immune system, which is too complex to just reverse (dont forget youre working in symbiosis with trillions of bacteria)
elo_info: In which case you'd have to accommodate for the wear and tear on your immune system, which is too complex to just reverse (don't forget you're working in symbiosis with trillions of bacteria)

reply_contents.content: Youd die of disease
elo_info: You'd die of disease
